name: RemoveFollowersFromProject
description:
Remove specified users from following a project in Asana.

This tool removes a list of specified users from following a project in Asana without affecting their membership status. It should be called when you want to update who follows a project without altering project membership.

parameters.name: project_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: A list of property names to include in the response, specified as strings. This should be used to include properties that are not returned by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: user_identifiers_to_unfollow
parameters.description: Array of user identifiers (e.g. "me", email, or gid) to remove from following the project.

value_schema.description: An array of strings identifying users. These can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to format the response with line breaks and indentation for readability. Useful for debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: project_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: data.followers
parameters.description: An array of strings identifying users. These can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

value_schema.description: An array of strings identifying users. These can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
